alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 9:56PM CST until February 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Accumulating Snow for Thursday... .A band of snow is expected to develop early Thursday morning, impacting portions of northeast Iowa and far southwest Wisconsin. Within heavier portions of the band, localized snow amounts greater than 6 inches are possible. A sharp gradient in snowfall amounts is expected with amounts decreasing drastically on the northern extent of the band. However, any shift north or south in the track of the winter storm will have impacts the location of the narrow snow band. If traveling Thursday, continue to monitor the forecast throughout the day for updates. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Highest amounts are most likely for the southern portions of the counties. * WHERE...In Iowa, Clayton County. In Wisconsin, Grant County. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
